intro: Hevea spruceana f. discolor, commonly known as the white-veined hevea, is a rare tropical plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pale venation on its leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers, which are typically followed by unique, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth, waxy texture. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
